docs.lead_paragraph: If influenza ever starts sweeping the globe, we'll all be depending on the World Health Organization's new chief of pandemic influenza to help stop it.

headline.main: Her Job: Helping Save the World From Bird Flu

docs.snippet: If influenza ever starts sweeping the globe, we'll all be depending on the World Health Organization's new chief of pandemic influenza to help stop it.

docs.lead_paragraph: JOHN PUTZIER figures he loses money every time he drives his 2001 Infiniti QX4 on a business trip. The standard reimbursement of 40.5 cents a mile can't keep pace with soaring gas prices, insurance bills and maintenance, he says. Yet Mr. Putzier, a human resources consultant in Prospect, Pa., in Butler County near Pittsburgh, says some clients pay him as little as 27.5 cents a mile.
docs.abstract: Christopher Elliott Sounding Off column on how business travelers are being shortchanged because employers are allowing only IRS rate for gasoline allowance at time when insurance rates have risen and gasoline prices are at record highs; says research firm Runzheimer International director Lee Czarapata says IRS rate effectively asks employees to subsidize cost of operating company's vehicle (M)
docs.snippet: With reimbursement rates for business travel far below the actual cost of gasoline, corporate America is basically asking its workers to subsidize high gas prices.

docs.lead_paragraph: Quest Diagnostics, one of the nation's largest operators of medical testing laboratories, said yesterday that it had agreed to buy LabOne for $934 million to offer services that help life insurance companies assess the risk of taking on policyholders. LabOne accounts for more than a quarter of the $1 billion a year in services like health exams and medical record checks sold to life insurance companies for risk assessment. LabOne also conducts lab tests for health care providers and drug screening for employers.
docs.abstract: Quest Diagnostics, one of nation's largest operators of medical testing laboratories, agrees to buy LabOne for $934 million to offer services that help life insurance companies assess risk of taking on policyholders (S)

docs.lead_paragraph: TRYING to figure out how many years you have left to live is not the most enjoyable way to spend a summer day. But it does have its benefits. It can help you decide how to invest, what kind of insurance policy to buy and, if you are old enough, whether to splurge on a grand vacation or make do with another trip to the beach this summer.

headline.main: Acting Like There's No Tomorrow When There May Be Many Tomorrows Left

docs.snippet: How long people think they will live affects their behavior.
